title: Triple-digit ocean temps in Florida could be a global record
description: The ocean temperature off the coast of South Florida reached triple digits, which could be a global record, according to experts.

title: Ex-Tennessee officer sues after department rescinds job offer because he has HIV
description: A former Memphis police officer of the year is suing the Nashville Police Department for rescinding a job offer after the department learned he has HIV

title: 3 found dead in car at gas station identified as Marines stationed nearby
description: Three men who were found dead over the weekend at a North Carolina gas station have been identified as Marine lance corporals from Camp Lejeune

title: Canadian search teams find body of a child who died in Nova Scotia flooding
description: Canadian police say the body of a child who went missing when the province of Nova Scotia was hit with extreme flooding has been recovered

title: Pete Davidson to do 50 hours community service after crash into Beverly Hills house
description: Pete Davidson will perform 50 hours of community service to resolve a reckless driving charge for crashing into a Beverly Hills home

title: Johnny Lujack, Heisman winner who led Notre Dame to 3 national titles, dies at 98
description: Johnny Lujack, the Heisman Trophy winner who led Notre Dame to three national championships in the 1940s, died in Florida following a brief illness

title: Lyle Lovett band member spots noose in Montana. Police investigating it as hate crime
description: Police in Montana's largest city are investigating a possible hate crime after a musician who performs with Lyle Lovett and His Large Band found a noose on a downtown light pole

title: Biden honors Emmett Till and his mother with new national monument
description: President Joe Biden honors Emmett Till and his mother Mamie Till-Mobley in a new national monument that spans several locations in Mississippi and Illinois.

title: American freed from Russia in prisoner swap hurt while fighting in Ukraine
description: Trevor Reed, has been injured while fighting in Ukraine, according to an official.

title: Mega Millions jackpot grows to $820M ahead of Tuesday's drawing
description: The Mega Millions jackpot has ballooned to an estimated $820 million ahead of Tuesday night's drawing, marking the eighth-largest top prize in U.S. lotto history.

title: UPS and Teamsters union reach agreement, avert strike
description: UPS and Teamsters faced a July 31 deadline.

title: Judge to weigh Hunter Biden plea deal that enflamed critics
description: President Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden will appear in a courtroom Wednesday to formally agree to the plea deal he negotiated last month with federal prosecutors.

title: Family desperate for answers after 39-year-old woman vanishes
description: Allisha Watts has been missing since July 16 and her family is worried about her safety, the Charlotte-Mecklenburg police said.

title: North Korea stonewalls US on status of detained soldier
description: Private Travis King’s state -- and what North Korea might want for him -- remains a mystery a week after his detention.

title: Judge says she won't change ruling letting NFL coach's racial discrimination claims proceed to trial
description: NFL Coach Brian Flores claims he and other Black coaches face discrimination.

title: Cases of tick-borne illnesses are on the rise. Some experts believe climate change is the cause
description: Many tick-borne illnesses are becoming more prevalent.

title: DeSantis uninjured in car crash while heading to event: Campaign
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis was in a car crash on Tuesday morning in Tennessee on the way to an event in Chattanooga, his campaign said.

title: 3 workers drown in drainage system at a waste disposal company in Germany
description: Police say three workers at a waste disposal and recycling company in southern Germany have died, apparently drowning in a drainage system

title: Bronny James, LeBron's son, suffers cardiac arrest during workout
description: Bronny James is an incoming freshman at USC.

title: Trader Joe's recalls 2 types of cookies that may contain rocks
description: Trader Joe's has issued a recall of its Almond Windmill Cookies and Trader Joe's Dark Chocolate Chunk and Almond Cookies due to possible contamination of rocks.

title: Boy, 10, fires shot at police called to scene after youth opens fire inside home
description: Police say a 10-year-old boy fired a shot at Chicago police officers during a standoff with officers called to the scene after the youth opened fire inside a home

title: Russian lawmakers extend age limit for compulsory military draft
description: The Russian parliament’s lower house has approved a bill extending the upper age limit for the compulsory military draft from 27 to 30, a move that appears to be part of efforts by the Kremlin to expand the military during the fighting in Ukraine

title: Mega Millions jackpot is the 8th largest in the US at $820 million
description: Lottery players now have a shot at a Mega Millions jackpot worth an estimated $820 million, days after someone hit a Powerball prize that topped $1 billion

title: Police seek suspects after luxury cars stolen from dealership in broad daylight
description: Toronto police are seeking help from the public to identify three suspects who allegedly stole luxury vehicles from a car dealership

title: Singer Tori Kelly being treated for multiple blood clots after collapsing
description: Singer Tori Kelly is in the hospital being treated for multiple blood clots after collapsing while out with friends Sunday night.

title: China removes outspoken foreign minister and replaces him with predecessor
description: China has removed the country's outspoken foreign minister, Qin Gang, from office and replaced him with his predecessor, Wang Yi

title: Russian fighter jet damages US Reaper drone with flare over Syria: Officials
description: A Russian fighter jet fired flares directly at an American MQ-9 Reaper drone over Syria on Sunday, damaging its propeller, according to U.S. Air Forces Central

title: Dozens dead, hundreds evacuated as wildfires rage in Algeria
description: At least 34 people have died and thousands more have been forced to evacuate as authorities battle raging wildfires in Algeria, Algeria’s Interior Ministry announced.

title: US heat wave stretches into Midwest, heading for Northeast: Latest forecast
description: A relentless heat wave that has had a swath of the southwestern United States in its chokehold is stretching into the Midwest on its way to the Northeast this week.

title: Israeli doctors walk off the job, more strikes threatened after divisive law passes
description: Thousands of Israeli doctors walked out of work, labor leaders threatened a general strike and senior justices rushed home from a trip abroad

title: 77 people are injured, 5 critically, after 2 buses collide at a S. African university
description: Police and transport authorities say two buses collided at the entrance to a South African university, injuring at least 77 people, two of them seriously

title: EU ministers meet to discuss vital Ukraine grain exports after Russia nixed deal
description: European Union agriculture ministers are meeting to discuss ways of moving grain vital to global food security out of Ukraine after Russia halted a deal that allowed the exports

title: Jury to deliver verdict over Brussels militant attacks that killed 32
description: A jury is expected to render its verdict Tuesday over Belgium’s deadliest peacetime attack

title: Anger grows in Odesa after Russian bombardment hits beloved historic sites
description: In just a week, Russia has fired dozens of missiles and drones at the Odesa region of Ukraine, hitting the historic city center that had been largely spared since the beginning of the war

title: Weather off the coast of Acapulco hinders efforts to find missing Baltimore man
description: Weather conditions are keeping the Mexican Navy from approaching the capsized sailboat of a missing U.S. citizen.

title: Strong typhoon blows closer to northern Philippines, forcing evacuations
description: A powerful typhoon is blowing closer to the northern Philippines, forcing thousands of evacuations and a halt to sea travel ahead of torrential rains and tidal surges near 10 feet

title: Current heat waves in North America, Europe 'impossible' without climate change
description: The dangerous heat waves currently plaguing the North American and European continents would be "virtually impossible" without human-caused climate change.

title: WATCH:  Lightning flashes over Arizona rainbow
description: A spectacular sight was seen over southern Arizona: A bolt of lightning flashed across the sky at the same time as a rainbow.

title: Human remains found in 3 separate suitcases in Florida, police say
description: Human remains were found inside three separate suitcases in Florida, according to law enforcement officials seeking information related to the gruesome discovery.
